body_html:
I was trying to install TensorFlow 0.9 on a Raspberry Pi 3, but I got an error that told me g++ could not static_cast from Eigen::half to float. The header Half.h is not there in the pulled eigen version.
Actually it seems TensorFlow declares struct half in namespace Eigen (header strcat.h) but does not instantiates it. Maybe this is normally done in Half.h...

I also tried to pull eigen myself and change the #include path, but it didn't changed anything.
body_text:
I was trying to install TensorFlow 0.9 on a Raspberry Pi 3, but I got an error that told me g++ could not static_cast from Eigen::half to float. The header Half.h is not there in the pulled eigen version.
Actually it seems TensorFlow declares struct half in namespace Eigen (header strcat.h) but does not instantiates it. Maybe this is normally done in Half.h...
I also tried to pull eigen myself and change the #include path, but it didn't changed anything.
body:
I was trying to install `TensorFlow 0.9` on a Raspberry Pi 3, but I got an error that told me g++ could not `static_cast` from `Eigen::half` to `float`. The header Half.h is not there in the pulled eigen version. 
Actually it seems TensorFlow declares `struct half` in `namespace Eigen` (header `strcat.h`) but does not instantiates it. Maybe this is normally done in Half.h...

I also tried to pull eigen myself and change the `#include` path, but it didn't changed anything.
